sources.title: Data Sources
sources.subtitle: Learn about the scientific instruments and networks that power ICA Predict
sources.groundDescription: Ground-based monitoring stations provide validation and complementary measurements to satellite data.
sources.dataIntegrationText: ICA Predict combines satellite observations from NASA TEMPO with ground-based measurements from Pandora, TolNet, and OpenAQ networks to provide comprehensive air quality assessments.
sources.qualityAssuranceText: All data undergoes rigorous quality control procedures. Satellite retrievals are validated against ground-based measurements to ensure accuracy. Data quality flags are applied to all observations.
sources.aqiCalculationText: Air Quality Index values are calculated following EPA standards using measured concentrations of key pollutants including ozone, nitrogen dioxide, sulfur dioxide, and particulate matter.
sources.forecastModelsText: Forecasts are generated using historical data patterns, current observations, and meteorological forecasts. Machine learning models help predict pollution transport and dispersion.
sources.attributionText: All data sources used in ICA Predict are publicly available and open access. We acknowledge:

attributionList.tempo: NASA TEMPO mission and the Atmospheric Science Data Center
attributionList.pandora: NASA Pandora Project at Goddard Space Flight Center
attributionList.openaq: OpenAQ and contributing data providers worldwide
attributionList.epa: U.S. EPA for AQI methodology and health guidelines

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Manage your preferences and account settings
settings.dataExportStarted: Data export started - this feature is coming soon!
settings.savedLocationsDescription: Quickly access air quality data for your favorite locations
settings.accountInfoDescription: Optional - Sign in to sync across devices
settings.name: Name
settings.dataManagementDescription: Manage your air quality data and privacy
settings.exportDescription: Download all your saved locations, preferences, and alert history
settings.clearDataDescription: Remove all locally stored data from this browser
settings.privacyText: ICA Predict respects your privacy. We only collect data necessary to provide air quality information. Location data is only used when you explicitly request it and is not stored on our servers.

good.general: Air quality is satisfactory, and air pollution poses little or no risk.
good.children: Great day for outdoor play and activities.
good.athletes: Perfect conditions for outdoor exercise and training.

moderate.general: Air quality is acceptable. However, there may be a risk for some people, particularly those who are unusually sensitive to air pollution.
moderate.sensitive: Consider reducing prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion.
moderate.elderly: It's generally safe, but watch for any unusual symptoms.
moderate.children: Reduce prolonged or heavy outdoor activities.
moderate.athletes: Consider reducing the intensity of outdoor workouts.

unhealthySensitive.general: Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects. The general public is less likely to be affected.
unhealthySensitive.sensitive: Reduce prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion. Take more breaks during outdoor activities.
unhealthySensitive.elderly: Consider moving activities indoors or rescheduling to when air quality is better.
unhealthySensitive.children: Reduce prolonged or heavy outdoor activities. Schedule outdoor activities when air quality is better.
unhealthySensitive.athletes: Reduce the intensity and duration of outdoor exercise.

unhealthy.general: Some members of the general public may experience health effects; members of sensitive groups may experience more serious health effects.
unhealthy.sensitive: Avoid prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion. Move activities indoors or reschedule.
unhealthy.elderly: Stay indoors and keep activity levels low. Follow your doctor's advice about medication use.
unhealthy.children: Avoid prolonged or heavy outdoor activities. Move activities indoors or reschedule.
unhealthy.athletes: Move workouts indoors or reschedule to when air quality improves.

veryUnhealthy.general: Health alert: The risk of health effects is increased for everyone.
veryUnhealthy.sensitive: Avoid all physical activity outdoors. Move activities indoors or reschedule.
veryUnhealthy.elderly: Remain indoors and keep activity levels low. Consult your doctor if you experience symptoms.
veryUnhealthy.children: Avoid all physical activity outdoors. Keep children indoors.
veryUnhealthy.athletes: Avoid all outdoor exercise. Move workouts indoors.

hazardous.general: Health warning of emergency conditions: everyone is more likely to be affected.
hazardous.sensitive: Remain indoors and keep activity levels low. Follow emergency health protocols.
hazardous.elderly: Remain indoors and keep activity minimal. Seek medical attention if experiencing symptoms.
hazardous.children: Keep children indoors with minimal activity. Ensure proper air filtration if available.
hazardous.athletes: Avoid all outdoor activities. Cancel or postpone outdoor training and events.

moderate: Watch for symptoms if you're sensitive
Reduce prolonged heavy exertion if needed
unhealthySensitive: Sensitive groups should reduce outdoor activity
Take more breaks during outdoor activities
unhealthy: Sensitive groups should avoid outdoor activities
Close windows and use air filtration
veryUnhealthy: Follow your doctor's advice about using rescue inhalers
hazardous: Keep activity levels to a minimum
Seek medical attention if experiencing symptoms

footer.aboutText: Real-time air quality monitoring powered by NASA's TEMPO satellite and ground station networks.
footer.copyright: ICA Predict. Built for NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025.
footer.dataProvided: Data provided by NASA TEMPO, Pandora, OpenAQ, and other public sources.
